derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from Icelandic Geysir, the name of a particular spring in Iceland; related to geysa 'to gush'

entry.def: A geyser is a hole in the Earth's surface from which hot water and steam are forced out, usually at irregular intervals of time.

means.word_mean: 1. a spring that discharges hot water and steam
